author: wtf_is_up
body:
CDNS - Cadence Design Systems

They sell all sorts of design software / platforms / IP for chip design across a bunch of different sectors.  Strong ROIC and similar to returns to other semi equipment companies like LRCX, AMAT, KLAC, ASML without the cyclical ups and downs.

POOL -  I don't understand this one, but it just goes up.  I would love to understand what they do that's special  in the pool industry that allows them to compound for years.

author: JakeSmithsPhone
body: I like ONTO more on a comparative basis. They have a technological edge with their equipment and are way under valued. They are taking at about 21 P/E right now, but as they build out their portfolio, they expect to earn over $5/sh with increased margins. So, a FPE of closer to 7. AMAT is a great company, but they are already built out. ONTO has that TAM SAM gap to fill in addition to eating market share and the growing industry. I wouldn't be shocked if AMAT or LRCX buys ONTO, frankly. It would make sense.

But right now I would buy Intel, Lam Research, Applied Materials and some Qualcomm if you have non. Even if they continue to perform poorly you will still see nice gains because of the high growth. At some point they cannot be ignored anymore.

author: JohnKerryTouchedMe
body:
Long term. As we saw with the pandemic, Costco, Home Depot, etc. They weren't as vulnerable as other stocks like Airlines, banking, food production, some Tech, insurance companies, niche markets, Looking at you Starbucks, etc. 


Now if I'm looking for a long position I'm looking for a stock that doesn't give a shit about the election. AMAT is a great example of that. I had UBER for a while and then heard the stirrings of the employee/contractor debate and got the fuck out immediately. 

I want something that will hold up well during almost anything and could almost be considered a necessity to most. UPS,  FedEx, Amazon, Cloud companies, Software. People need their shit. 

The whole EV market right now is propped up by Tesla, most would be half their price without it. And one bad earnings report and it tanks.  

Short positions I just ride the trend. Hop on and get out. Buy the rumor, sell the news. Sell if your loss exceeds 10%. This will give you a bit more capital to expand your long term positions. Because you can't exactly sell and then buy more. 

Trevena for instance is finally coming out of it's little shit hole of a rollercoaster and I came out $380 up for the day.

Before you buy a stock act like you have to leave the room and ask your boss for permission to buy. This will cut out impulsive buying and jumping in on a shit EP. 

Also now that I'm thinking about it TelaDoc is right around the perfect entry point. I'd buy 1, see what happens next week or two and then average out if you like it. Or just dump it. But once the merger is complete that thing will fly. I've got 16 shares and it's treated me well. Stalled this week though. But honestly look into AMAT and semiconductor companies as well. Consistently good earnings reports are great but look what happens if they have one bad quarter and see how fast they bounce back. That's what you want. Plus good dividends. My neighbor makes stupid money and he's got 2000 shares of AMAT and swears by it.

Edit: 
https://www.investors.com/ibd-data-tables/

https://www.investors.com/data-tables/dividend-leaders-aug-27-2020/

https://www.investors.com/data-tables/etf-leaders-aug-27-2020/

author: JhoLow1MDB
body: They had a slight miss due to supply chain issues related to COVID, but their future guidance was very bullish.  They claimed that not only would they make up the lost revenue, but they also had record back orders to fill PLUS record orders to fill for the next quarter (the one now being reported).  AMAT should be flying with the growth of cloud computing, 5G, AI, big data, and the internet of things. Iirc, last quarter was one of the only ones in like the past 5 or 10 years where they didn't beat, and it was because of COVID.

author: maybeguineapig
body: AMAT shares.

author: JhoLow1MDB
body:
I own the actual stock.  At least last ER call they said there was a slight earnings miss because of supply chain issues due to COVID restrictions.  They couldn't fill all orders. However, the call sounded super bullish, because they had a record backlog of orders to fill and had a record number of orders to fill for the next quarter.  They also said that the supply chain issues had passed, and that they expected to recoup the slightly missed earnings over the rest of the year.  

I mean I'd expect a healthy ER based on last quarter's call.  The bigger picture is that 5g, AI, cloud computing, the internet of things, etc. etc. all mean that there will be a big demand for AMAT products and services for the foreseeable future.

author: radarbot
body:
This is kind of my strategy too. I have a few different piles based on doing research of active invested fund portfolios, industry trends and my own gut feeling:

1. Cloud computing (ie. NET, FSLY, etc)
2. Digital communications (ie. TWLO, BAND, ORBC, NOK etc)
3. Modernized Healthcare (ie. CRSP, NVTA, ARCT, TDOC, LVGO, etc)
4. Renewable Energy (ie. SPWR, SEDG, RUN, BEP, NEE, etc)
5. Ecommerce (ie. SQ, V, PYPL, etc)
6. Tech hardware (ie. AMD, AMAT, MU, TSM, TER,)

I've tried a DCA average into most of these stocks, but the current run up has been savage on my mental strain as some of these stocks are moving much faster than I expected, which is fucking with my DCA strategy.

Thanks for your response, I think we're all in the same boat and its all about discipline in this whacky market.

AMAT is a Great choice, now that its down a bit from its earnings beat. Also just received numerous price uprgades in the $80s. Stock price sits at $66; so youre looking at a possible $15-20K gain in the next two weeks if the market cooperates. 

If youre looking for High risk with tons of upside I reccommend CLSK, which sits at $11-12. Possible gain of $68k if it hits a high of $18. speculative growth company with growing revenues. The market loves these.
